quizzes.question: How does the single line comment look like?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]JavaScript Comments[/h1]

Not all JavaScript statements are "executed".
Code after a double slash //, or between /* and */, is treated as a [b]comment[/b].
Comments are ignored, and are not executed.

[b]Single line[/b] comments use double slashes.[code format="html" codeId="645"]<script>
   [b]// This is a single line comment[/b]
   alert("This is an alert box!");
</script>[/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2737" width="100%"]

quizzes.question:
Create a multi-line comment in JavaScript.
[!raw!]
{0} this is a
multiline
comment {1}
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Multiple-Line Comments[/h1]

Everything you write between /*and */ will be considered as a multi-line comment.

Here is an example. [code format="html" codeId="646"]<script>
   /* This code 
   creates an 
   alert box */
   alert("This is an alert box!");
</script>[/code]
[note]Comments are used to describe and explain what the code is doing.[/note]
